website_summaries.verdict: The cute and cheerful egg-shaped microscope introduces young users to the world of digital magnification, encouraging a lifelong interest in learning about science.
pros: Easy for little hands to hold and use
Comes with 2 head adapters, enabling better close-up viewing of objects
Focusing is a simple turn of the top
Great for classrooms, as images can be projected onto a screen or whiteboard
cons: Doesn't have a ton of magnification – only up to 43x – and might not entertain older students

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good. Could be better.
customer_reviews.text: Everything functions fine, but the resolution on the camera is very poor (aside from magnification). The packaged app for Windows use is okay, but after trying it, I decided that I prefer the standard Windows camera interface (Windows 8.1 in my case, but probably works with older versions). This is basically a low-quality USB web cam with a magnifying glass and 4 LEDs attached to it. A nice kid's toy, but should be updated with higher quality image processing (how about at least 4 megapixel?).
customer_reviews.author: jertyler

customer_reviews.title: Great for use with a Chrome notebook
customer_reviews.text: After unsuccessfully trying to download the Zoomy software onto our Mac, we decided to try to use our Chrome notebook (which is my 7 yo son's designated computer anyway). Instead of downloading Zoomy-specific software, we used the WebCam toy from the Chrome webstore ([...]), and it worked great! You can even share the image on various social networks. Unfortunately, with this particular software, you can't take movies, but perhaps other software would have that capability. Aside from that, the microscope is awesome--fun, good resolution and super kid-friendly. I teach Biology, and I'm definitely going to bring this to my class. I could even hook it into the digital projector. Highly recommended. We're having so much fun!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole H. Markelz

customer_reviews.title: Makes learning fun
customer_reviews.text: Very interesting and fun piece of equipment. I bought it for a young, smart, and inquisitive child in the family. He has a lot of fun using it. And as an adult, I am fascinated with looking at things with it, too. It is a great tool for children to learn and see things that are impossible to see with the naked eye.
customer_reviews.author: Linda S.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with Mac
customer_reviews.text: It comes with a mini-disk that can only be used with a slot-loading drive. It's on their website to download it, but that "newest version" doesn't work with current macs. Useless.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy-Michelle Reid

customer_reviews.title: Zoomy is an excellent kid's microscope
customer_reviews.text: The Zoomy microscope is easy to load software for and starts up with no problem. My ten-year-old uses it as part of home school, to look at, identify & record all sorts of cool bugs. I think it well worth the $50 we spent. The USB connection is convenient and the pictures can be saved in .jpg format, the same as photos.
customer_reviews.author: Wizard of WID

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend for the young and old
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the neatest tech gadgets that I've seen in a while. My two 8-year old kids love it, but our entire family, young and old where crowded around the computer. It's very simple to use. Just download the software and plug it into a USB port. It's simply fascinating and the uses are endless. The image quality is spectacular.
customer_reviews.author: JCash

customer_reviews.title: Performed as expected. Great for kids as an introductory tool, perhaps.
customer_reviews.text: This is very cool. It's not all that "high-powered", but for basic magnification of things "above the microscopic level", it's a neat toy and works quite well. Easy to install with Windows too. I'd recommend it to anyone, especially if there's young inquisitive minds in mind. ;o)
customer_reviews.author: James S.Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Great for school science fair projects
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for an elementary school science fair project. It worked great on two fronts. My daughter and her friend were able to independently take photos of crystal structures to print to Shutterfly for her poster. The resolution was decent enough to print 4x6 photos from the snap shots. We were also able to bring it to school plugged to a laptop to make an interactive exhibit for her friends to try it out. Six months later still going strong despite some "uneducational" use by my kids. Good value for the money as I expect to use it in the years to come. Great find!
customer_reviews.author: Shesh

customer_reviews.title: A closer look at the world
customer_reviews.text: We've had this nearly a year now, and it's been worth every penny. We get it out at least once a month to discover something new; whether it's an interesting rock, a vegetable, the inside of a tooth (EW!!), or whatever, this thing takes great up-close shots. I only wish this was mobile so we could take it out into the field; it just means we have to bring the field indoors :-) This is fun for any budding scientist, or even adults to take a closer look at the world.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Learning Tool & Toy
customer_reviews.text: This was a big hit with my granddaughter, her siblings and her parents! She wanted a microscope for her birthday but, with 3 younger siblings, it would get easily broken. Zoomy magnified lots of things easily and the magnification showed up on the computer screen for all to see. It was everything I was hoping it would be.
customer_reviews.author: Schoolzout

customer_reviews.title: Christmas gift for a curious 8-year-old
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my Granddoughter, who is always curious about bugs and outdoor things. Within a day she had sent pictures (taken right from the computer and sent off) of salt,sand, dirt, skin...and nose hairs! Magnification is decent and focus is simple. She loves it! Mom and Dad love it because it was so easy to get up and running on their laptop. I tried it at home and it was easy to get going on my Mac as well. Easy for a kid to use too. How can you go wrong?
customer_reviews.author: Laura Denne

customer_reviews.title: perfect for a young scientist
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 7-year old. We have had many "adventures" looking at leaves, bird feathers, fingerprints and such. This has been great for learning about the "smaller world." This unit also allows for taking still images and videos. It is sturdy and hand-held - perfect for a young scientist.
customer_reviews.author: not now

customer_reviews.title: Perfect way to show many people up close images
customer_reviews.text: This is a grea little microscope. It takes great pictures. I like that it is very user friendly. You don't have to worry about cracking lenses like you do with other microscopes. I purchased this for my 7 year old son for Christmas. He has loved it. He has captured many amazing images with this. I have used it as well with my students.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: It's "okay"
customer_reviews.text: More like a magnifying tool than a microscope. You can't see closer surfaces for germs, etc. But it was fun for what it offered. The downside is that it comes with a mini disc to connect to usb. The problem with that is a lot of computers no longer use discs and it was a pain finding the download link from the site.
customer_reviews.author: Prof. Shelby

customer_reviews.title: A great gift for a young person interested in science
customer_reviews.text: A great gift for a young person interested in science. I bought it as a gift for my nephew. The product would be a bit more interesting, and would provide more entertainment/education if it had a higher level of magnification. This is essentially a very strong digital magnifying glass, not so much a microscope. Still a cool product.
customer_reviews.author: christian

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't expecting to like it as much as we did
customer_reviews.text: This turned out to be a hit! Wasn't expecting to like it as much as we did...the entire family!! We have so much fun with it with the kids (7 and 4). Nice supplement to the regular microscope. Hide the small pieces though. My son got it stuck on his finger twice! :) Fortunately a little olive oil and it slid right off and cleaned up fine.
customer_reviews.author: BoodlesBecky

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: We gave this to my 8 year old daughter for Christmas because she loves science. It was really easy to get it set up and within minutes she and her 4 year old brother and their dad were having a blast looking at everything from freckles to rocks to earwax to fabric. I can't wait to see what she picks up in the yard when spring/summer come along to look at with this microscope!
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Good for younger students
customer_reviews.text: An easy to use handheld microscope. My grade 1-3s were all able to use it very easily after a quick lesson. The magnification is acceptable for younger students but won't be of much use once they are in upper primary and high school.
customer_reviews.author: HonestOpinionsOnly

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little microscope to pique children's interest in science
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little microscope to pique children's interest in science! My sons love playing with it and exploring their world. I plan on taking it into my classroom to let students explore with it as well.
customer_reviews.author: grade1teacher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent present for kids - they really liked it
customer_reviews.text: Excellent present for kids - they really liked it! The attached small CD has viewer software, which worked OK on Mac Book (did not test on Windows). One suggestion - it would be better to have the software online, as many new Mac laptops do not have DVD/CD drive anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Pavel H

customer_reviews.title: Your paying for the brand name.
customer_reviews.text: It is pretty good, but I found another for half the price that magnifies better.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous to 72547

customer_reviews.title: It gets most of my RCFA cases done!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not the first to buy this little guy at work, and neither am I the last! Coworkers ask to borrow it frequently
customer_reviews.author: W/E

customer_reviews.title: Digital microscope-Toy
customer_reviews.text: You will have so much fun with this Digital microscope. The only problem is the cord is so short that you have to unplug the laptop and carry it out side to play with it. But, it's still is a blast to play with and is better than the $85.00 one I bought.
customer_reviews.author: RT2

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable price for a pretty good resolution
customer_reviews.text: It's been entertaining for my 4 year old and easily manipulated. Focusing take a little supervision but it can focused once at a reasonable depth. Come spring time we'll try looking at more things like bugs and plants.
customer_reviews.author: Israel Diperi

customer_reviews.title: Very cool!
customer_reviews.text: Our grandkids love this computer connected microscope. It is very interesting to use to look at insects, rocks, leaves etc.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Plug and play on my Windows Surface. Shows great detail and it's kid friendly!
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the classroom
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Gift for my daughter a teacher. Kids in the class are fascinated
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun gift
customer_reviews.text: We gave this to our 8 year old Granddaughter for Christmas. It worked really well and turned out to be fun for the entire family. I was surprised at how clear the pictures were and it was very easy to set up..It arrived when promised and was exactly as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift but my grandson never seemed to be interested in it.
customer_reviews.author: cheripie

customer_reviews.title: Great for my kids
customer_reviews.text: A fun learning tool, they are having a blast looking at everything around them. Could use a stand though, the button is bulky and on top, so pushing it moves the scope and the picture is out of focus.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: We all got a kick out of it!
customer_reviews.text: Very interesting to look that close to your skin and clothing. We had a fun afternoon searching for things to inspect. While I like that it comes over the computer screen and you can see a large size, I wish it had a little more freedom versus being tethered to the computer. All in all, really fun. My 6 year old loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Elle Cee

customer_reviews.title: This is great for primary-aged students
customer_reviews.text: This would be a great addition to any preK, K, or 1st grade classroom. It is durable, yet precise enough for young children to use with guidance and to obtain the details they are searching for.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Marlatt

customer_reviews.title: zoomy zooms ahead of the pack
customer_reviews.text: Zoomy is a hand held microscope that does it all. It is great for real time exploration and would be a welcome device for project work in any elementary science classroom. Duration has been good so far but children are the best product testers.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Mcdonald

customer_reviews.title: The Low kids to the High kids will love these in your classroom
customer_reviews.text: Every Classroom needs these! Kids from 4 and up can use them to explore textures, bugs, etc... The Low kids to the High kids will love these in your classroom!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Evans

customer_reviews.title: Really fun and educational, great for all ages.
customer_reviews.text: This can be used as a toy, at school, for photos and for movies. I could see the inside of my nose and my ear. We used it to see our dogs skin (yuke). My dad is having as much fun with it as I am.
customer_reviews.author: M.M.L.F.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: My five year old daughter immediately showed interest and began searching for things to look for on her own. She can operate it herself.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cr

customer_reviews.title: My kids enjoy looking at so many things with it
customer_reviews.text: This is a really neat magnifier. My kids enjoy looking at so many things with it.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna

customer_reviews.title: Zoomy Microscope
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my daughter (13) for Christmas. Loves it! Very clear images, easy to use and wow does it magnify! Great for homeschool or just for fun. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Microscope
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loved this microscope. We started looking at coins and lego toys, but ended up doing 'more interesting' things like belly buttons and the dog's hair. It is a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Hometown72

customer_reviews.title: Good fun
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good little microscope. Still using it 2 years later. The kids love looking at bugs and around their bodies with it.
customer_reviews.author: CatMc

customer_reviews.title: Thank you
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this little gadget. But beware...it is really good and I really hate seeing what is under his fingernails and in his scabs!! LOL
customer_reviews.author: momof1

customer_reviews.title: Friend said her daughter loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Gave it as a gift. Friend said her daughter loved it!
customer_reviews.author: HulaGirl

customer_reviews.title: works as described....great little gadget
customer_reviews.text: I got it to amaze grandkids and they were spellbound. It does the job I wanted it to do. It was easy to install and use on several different computers.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Exciting Microscopic Investigations Around the Corner
customer_reviews.text: I bought four of these for the 1st-4th grade teachers at our local elementary school. They LOVED them. Their classrooms have projectors in them so the teacher could hook it to their laptop and show the whole class what was under the scope. They are cooking up plans for exciting observations! My only issue is that a month later the price dropped 20%.
customer_reviews.author: Aspen Logic Guy

customer_reviews.title: cool
customer_reviews.text: cool little cam/scope to look at coins and circuit boards up close.
customer_reviews.author: olds442_hurst

customer_reviews.title: Great family activity
customer_reviews.text: Great introductory microscope that the whole family can enjoy. Easy enough for our 6 and 8 year olds to handle and use with the computer.
customer_reviews.author: Grama

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My kids (3 and 6) love exploring bugs, grass, hair, dirt with this fun little microscope
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Wow factor
customer_reviews.text: Kindergartener and First grader friendly. Easy to use and makes descriptions more detailed. If they make a stand it would be 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: nancy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to use and is an awesome way to see the world closer.
customer_reviews.author: KKM1224

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: my son loves this thing and it keeps him busy.
customer_reviews.author: Myrtle

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic educational/scientific tool.... oops toy
customer_reviews.text: My great nephews in 3 different cities loved it.. Fantastic educational/scientific tool.... oops toy. Either way the microworld is being seriously investigated by inquiring young minds.
customer_reviews.author: E. Boydstun

customer_reviews.title: Zoomy accolades!
customer_reviews.text: The Zoomy is a great tool for children to use for science exploration. I have them in my classroom and decided to buy on for my 6yr. old granddaughter and she immediately began to manipulate it with instructions. I would recommend this product to introduce children to a world of science that is not seen with the naked eye.
customer_reviews.author: Nadine B. Reid

customer_reviews.title: 6 yr old really likes it.
customer_reviews.text: fun to play with.. Daughter lovs it, and always is trying to find something to look at. I found It interesting to show them their hands when they are dirty. After a hand washing the dirt is gone;
customer_reviews.author: Prosise

customer_reviews.title: Like the product I did change the mount by cutting ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have owned. Gave the first one away. Like the product I did change the mount by cutting bottom off a vitamin bottle. Mouth of bottle perfect fit for Zoomy.
customer_reviews.author: edwin r. fite

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun!!!
customer_reviews.text: Kids love it they have examined near everything in the house. Easy to setup and use. Would def recommend. Warning dont look in your own ears. LOL
customer_reviews.author: jWilliam Strongbow

customer_reviews.title: Returned, Not Mac Compatible
customer_reviews.text: These did not work with my Mac. I tried downloading from the website, etc. but couldn't get the Zoomy to work. Finally I found a review at their website that stated, despite Learning Resources' claims to the contrary, it really doesn't work with current Mac software. It's really too bad because I haven't found anything else like this.
customer_reviews.author: Beatrice Tower

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what my granddaughter wanted and was on sale. Her school had this and she wanted one just like it. Great delivery service.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Manning

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install and great fun
customer_reviews.text: As represented. My class of 5 and 6 year olds can use it independently. Very easy to install and great fun.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: seeing the world up close
customer_reviews.text: your product is excellent and I enjoy useing it very much. I see the world like never before. Thank You so much for offering this type of product.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Fun, fun, fun!
customer_reviews.text: Easy for a three year old to operate herself. She loves to look at everything (teeth, hair, bugs, shells)...awesome microscope!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: very good seller
customer_reviews.text: very good product just as advertised very pleased with item very easy to download program and use the product much better than advertized
customer_reviews.author: james fay

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We love our zoomy! I was very impressed at how detailed the images were. It is very easy to focus and takes high quality pictures. I bought the zoomy for our kids, but am actually thinking of getting one for work. They would be great in the classroom too.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Mac OS 10.9
customer_reviews.text: I could not install Zoomy on a Mac, even after downloading the latest software from their website. I contacted the company and was told that it is not yet compatible with Mac OS 10.9 (Mavericks) and that it might be six months before it is compatible. I can understand the difficulty in keeping up with new operating systems, but I think it is terrible that the company does not clearly state on their website that it is not compatible with all Macs. They are disappointing a lot of children whose parents got this as a gift for them.
customer_reviews.author: NYC272

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use with my 4th grade science class. I have tried unsuccessfully to get it to work with my computer. I pulled in our district tech, and he worked for several hours two different times, and was also unable to get the dowloaded software to recognize the device. He took it home to try on two of his computers, still with no success. Because I purchased it in the summer, and didn't try to use it until November, I am out of luck in returning it. I would highly recommend not purchasing this item from my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Anne-Marie

customer_reviews.title: Zoomy is a must have!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Zoomy for my 6 year old because he shows an interest in science, but I have been having as much or more fun using it myself. It has a much clearer picture than I ever thought something in this price range would have had. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: Waiting to return. Company taking sweet time in responding. Does not work on Mac. Not matter what they say. Do not buy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, just slightly misleading info
customer_reviews.text: I could not tell from either the description or the reviews that the device HAS to be plugged into a computer to work. The device, as a stand-alone item, is fine; it's just the lack of full description. We wanted a device for field inspection and use. We returned it and bought something else that better fitted our needs. So, the device had no flaws, only my expectations were disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Welcome Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with MAC OSX 10.8.2
customer_reviews.text: Returned, would not show up on my laptop with the most up to date software for the mac as of January 2013.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan B Hughes

customer_reviews.title: worthless without software
customer_reviews.text: Came with a disk I can't run on my mac and I was unable to find a software download online.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Zaragoza

customer_reviews.title: Works for PC but not for Mac
customer_reviews.text: If you own a Mac you have experienced compatibly issues. I have spent time trying to get accessories to talk to a Mac and given up frustrated. That is why I always check the reviews before buying an accessory for my Mac. This is the review warning you that the Zoomy may not work with your Mac and definitely does not work with Mac Mini running OS 10.6 The Zoomy does work well with my PC but the software and the person who wrote the software both suck.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Electric

product_meta.title: Learning Resources Zoomy Handheld Digital Microscope
product_meta.description:
Inspire curiosity with this Handheld Digital Microscope. Display amazing images, up to 43x magnification, right onto your computer screen. Easy for a child to use; simply hold the egg-shaped device in your hand and move over any object for easy viewing. Compatible with PC and Mac.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Amazing all-in-one digital microscope takes scientific inquiry to a new level—yet is easy for even a young child to use. Hold the hand-friendly scope over an object, turn the top to focus, then press the single control button to take videos or still images from 35 to 53x magnification on a 14" monitor. Supports students as they record observations and investigations. Great for lab reports, presentations and authentic assessment for digital portfolios. Sharply detailed images enrich whole-class and individual explorations. Use with your computer, projector or interactive whiteboard. Downloads and charges via USB. Features 640 x 480 pixels (interpolation up to 1200 x 1600 pixels), VGA CMOS sensor, LED illumination, fun special effects (photo frames) and 2 head adapters for viewing different kinds of subjects. Compatible with Mac and PC (XP, Vista, Win7). Measures 2"L x 2.5”H. Grades PreK–12
feature_bullets: All-in-one digital microscope brings technology into the hands of young learners
Encourages hands-on investigation and facilitates scientific observation
Fits perfectly in child’s hand and positions easily to view difficult objects
Powered by USB connection to your computer — no batteries required

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
